text:
In this file, the lines that invoke the java interpreter to run the various 
classes are missing the -classpath parameter.

example entry:

Before my fix:

:runServer
rem Running Tomcat in this window
if "%2" == "-security" goto runSecure
%_RUNJAVA% %TOMCAT_OPTS% -Dtomcat.home="%TOMCAT_HOME%" 
org.apache.tomcat.startup.Tomcat %2 %3 %4 %5 %6 %7 %8 %9
goto cleanup

After my fix:

:runServer
rem Running Tomcat in this window
if "%2" == "-security" goto runSecure
%_RUNJAVA% %TOMCAT_OPTS% -classpath %CP% -Dtomcat.home="%TOMCAT_HOME%" 
org.apache.tomcat.startup.Tomcat %2 %3 %4 %5 %6 %7 %8 %9
goto cleanup
creator: davidm@wrq.com

text:
Win9x has a command line length limit which is all to easily exceeded when
using the "-classpath" parameter.  As a result, the tomcat.bat file by
design uses the CLASSPATH environment variable instead.  There are still
"out of environment" problems, but you can use CLASSPATH's much longer than
what you can get with "-classpath".
creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
